item.title: VGA arbiter: removing RAC
item.author: Author
item.description: The Resource Access Control inside Xorg is the guy responsible to take care of the various resources of memory and to share them in a wise manner when two or more graphics devices are active (think multi-head). As an alternative from RAC we can rely on VGA arbiter. So me and Paulo Zanoni spent the last days implementing “the glue” of Xorg to use the arbiter code with this purpose.
